LanguageData.DeathOfFactionPawn: Your incompetence has led to the death of a pawn from your settlements! Unrest has grown in your subject settlements.
LanguageData.CaptureOfFactionPawn: Capturing one of your settlement's pawns has caused great unrest in your subject settlements!
LanguageData.UnpaidTitheEffect: Unrest has increased by 10 and happiness has decreased in the settlement!
LanguageData.AlreadyUpgradeSettlement: This settlement is already being upgraded!
LanguageData.StartUpgradeSettlement: The settlement is now being upgraded...
LanguageData.BuildingInvalidEnvironment: That building cannot be built on this settlement's biome!
LanguageData.FCDescSeaIce: Endless sheets of ice unbroken by nothing, little animals, and no food except that which is grown in heated rooms. Only the most tenacious of life survives here.
LanguageData.FCDescIceSheet: Bleak, unending frost blankets the land, interrupted only by outcroppings of stone and ruins. The only source of food is the hardy wildlife which calls this place its home.
LanguageData.FCDescTundra: The hinterland houses a variety of rugged flora and fauna eking out an existance on the moss-covered landscape. When the summer comes, the land blooms into life, if only briefly.
LanguageData.FCDescColdBog: The rugged beauty of this land is matched only by its inhospitability. Marshes dot the landscape, as do frequent packs of migrating herbivores and the predators that follow them.
LanguageData.FCDescBorealForest: While typically less cold than the hinterland of a tundra, a boreal forest's harsh weather is only matched by its warm summers, where green blooms and food becomes plentiful until next winter.
LanguageData.FCDescTropicalRainforest: Trees choke the sky, ensuring little light reaches the floor. Regardless, there is a dazzling, but deadly, array of flora and fauna. The beauty of this biome is matched only by the dangers within.
LanguageData.FCDescTemperateForest: Abundant forests and streams split the land. Animals roam the thick forests and both food and shelter are aplenty.
LanguageData.FCDescTemperateSwamp: The land is covered by bogs and marshes, and what isn't, is covered by a variety of vegetation. Available building space is at a premium here.
LanguageData.FCDescTropicalSwamp: Both the sky and ground is strangled by vegetation, as trees reach for the sky, ensuring little light reaches the treacherous grounds. Disease is rampant and frequent.
LanguageData.FCDescAridShrubland: While not a true desert, growing soil is at a premium thanks to the relentless heat. Most of the land is open, with secluded groves breaking the otherwise empty skyline.
LanguageData.FCDescDesert: Arable soil is a rarity, as the majority of the land here is covered in sand, some too treacherous to build on. Still, life clings to existance here, and the sands harbour a vibrant array of life
LanguageData.FCDescExtremeDesert: The sun has baked this land into a wasteland. There is almost no soil that can support proper vegetation, and that which there is, is poor in quality.
LanguageData.FCDescUnknown: Little is widely known about the surrounding land, but the colony manages to survive and prosper in their present conditions.
LanguageData.FCTownLevel1: The settlement itself is simply a small cluster of buildings grouped around a central structure.
LanguageData.FCTownLevel2: The settlement is dominated by a few large structures, but it is still quite small. A number of sandbags and barricades ring the outside.
LanguageData.FCTownLevel3: The settlement has a good number of structures, largely production oriented, as well as dedicated storehouses, and busy workers scurry between them. A modest wall protects the settlement.
LanguageData.FCTownLevel4: The settlement is reasonably large, and well organised, with a number of industrial buildings clustered together to maximize efficiency. A thick wall and internal defenses protect the colony from attack.
LanguageData.FCTownLevel5: Clearly labelled buildings mark the industrial heart of this bustling beacon of civilization, as well as various other utilities . Multiple walls ring the colony, with plentiful interior defenses in carefully planned chokepoints.
LanguageData.settlementAboutToBeAttacked: {0} is about to be attacked by the {1} faction

LanguageData.defendingMilitaryReset: The defending military has been reset as the defense force for the settlement

LanguageData.RaidEnemySettlementFailure: The raid on {0} has resulted in failure
LanguageData.CaptureEnemySettlementSuccess: {0}'s military forces have successfully captured {1}. Due to the previous faction's tech level, the starting settlement level of the new settlement is {2}.
LanguageData.CaptureEnemySettlementFailure: {0}'s military forces has failed to capture {1}
LanguageData.MilitaryForcesReorganizing: {0}'s military forces are re-organizing after their last mission.
LanguageData.DefenseSuccessfulFull: The defense of {0} against the military might of {1} was successful!
LanguageData.DefenseFailureFull: The defense of our settlement, {0}, has been crushed by the forces of {1}.
LanguageData.BulidingDestroyedInRaid: {0} has been destroyed in the raid.
LanguageData.SettlementDeleveledRaid: The settlement level has decreased by one.
LanguageData.ResetToHomeSettlement: Reset to home settlement's defense - Mil {0}
LanguageData.EventAffectingSettlements: This event is affecting the following settlements:
LanguageData.OverwhelmingVictoryDesc: Due to your military force's overwhelming victory, the military force is still available for deployment.
LanguageData.TaxesFromSettlementAreBeingDelivered: Taxes from {0} are en-route to your tax collection point!
LanguageData.ResearchExpended: {0} points of research have been used to research {1}. You have {2} points remaining.
LanguageData.NoResearchExpended: No research has been used today. You have {0} points remaining.
LanguageData.PointsAddedToResearchPool: {0} points have been added to the research pool!
LanguageData.SetAsOutputSuccess: The transformer has been set as the power output for your settlements!
LanguageData.FCHeavyExplanation: Adds +2 to worker soft cap (Max Workers Before Scaling Costs). Reduces health by 20.
LanguageData.FCMediumExplanation: Adds +1 to worker soft cap (Max Workers Before Scaling Costs). Reduces health by 10.
LanguageData.FCLightExplanation: Adds +1 to worker hard cap (Over-Max Workers). Increases health by 4
LanguageData.SellPawnInfo: Value will be added to next bill from colony
LanguageData.PrisonerCaptureInfo: Prisoner: {0} has been enslaved and delivered to {1}
LanguageData.GoodsReceivedFollowing: You have received the following goods from the {0} event:
LanguageData.CurrentResearchLevel: Your current tech level is {0}. To reach the next tech level you must research {1}
LanguageData.CannotHaveLessThanOneRace: Cannot have less than one race in your faction
LanguageData.NotEnoughSilverForBill: You did not have enough silver to pay an outstanding bill from
LanguageData.ConfiscatedTithes: They have confiscated your tithes in return
LanguageData.Name: Name
LanguageData.NotEnoughSilverOnMapToPayBill: You do not have enough silver on the current map to pay the bill
LanguageData.CaravanOnWay: A caravan is already on its way
LanguageData.CaravanSentToLocation: A caravan has been sent to the location! They will arrive in

LanguageData.ButtonNotAvailable: This button is not available yet
LanguageData.PolicyAlreadyEnacted: That policy has already been enacted

LanguageData.AlreadyPolicyInSlot: There is already a policy being enacted in that slot
LanguageData.CouldNotFindMapOfCapital: Could not find map of capital
LanguageData.ResearchGeneratedWaste: Research points generated by your faction has been wasted as you have no research selected
LanguageData.EnactedInYourFaction: has been enacted in your faction
LanguageData.SelectTile: Select a tile to create the colony
LanguageData.SetAsFactionCapital: {0} has been set as the faction capital
LanguageData.FactionHappinessDesc: The measure of the faction's overall happiness. A high happiness means that any internal conflict within the settlement will lean heavily to your favor.
LanguageData.FactionLoyaltyDesc: The measure of the faction's overall loyalty. The loyalty of a settlement determines how willing the settlement is to listen to you. A high loyalty will reduce the chance of defection.
LanguageData.FactionUnrestDesc: The measure of the faction's overall unrest. The higher unrest grows, the more likely dangerous events internal in your faction will spark. Let it grow too high, and a faction-wide revolt may grow.
LanguageData.FactionProsperityDesc: The measure of the faction's overall prosperity. The prosperity of a town directly correlates with the production of resources. 50% prosperity = 50% production. If prosperity is damaged, it will slowly accumulate over time.
LanguageData.TotalFactionProduction: The total faction-wide production of the resource
LanguageData.BuildingAlreadyType: There is already a building of that type
LanguageData.NotEnoughSilverConstructBuilding: You do not have enough silver on the current map to construct that building
LanguageData.BuildingBeingBuiltAlreadyType: There is already a building of that type being built
LanguageData.BuildingAlreadyConstructed: There is already a building being constructed there
LanguageData.UpgradeColonyDesc: Upgrading this colony will increase the max worker count before the cost of workers begins to rise by 3 workers. The military level of this colony will also increase by 1.
LanguageData.NotEnoughSilverUpgrade: The current map does not have enough silver to pay for the settlement upgrade.
LanguageData.CannotBeUpgradedPastMax: This settlement cannot be upgraded past max level
LanguageData.SettlementProductionOf: The total settlement production of the resource
LanguageData.SettlementMilitaryLevelDesc: The measure of the settlements's military level. The military level of a town directly affects the town's ability to defend itself as well as attack external threats
LanguageData.SettlementHappinessDesc: The measure of the Settlement's overall happiness. A high happiness means that any internal conflict within the settlement will lean heavily to your favor.
LanguageData.SettlementLoyaltyDesc: The measure of the Settlement's overall loyalty. The loyalty of a settlement determines how willing the settlement is to listen to you. A high loyalty will reduce the chance of defection.
LanguageData.SettlementUnrestDesc: The measure of the Settlement's overall unrest. The higher unrest grows, the more likely dangerous events internal in your Settlement will spark. Let it grow too high, and a Settlement-wide revolt may grow.
LanguageData.SettlementProsperityDesc: The measure of the Settlement's overall prosperity. The prosperity of a town directly correlates with the production of resources. 50% prosperity = 50% production. If prosperity is damaged, it will slowly accumulate over time.
LanguageData.AddedInFuture: This will be added to in the future
